page.title: 03Barton Turf
page.content:
06340321 BARTON TURF: FARMING, HOUSING, DYKES
An area predominantly arable farming - sugarbeet, potatoes, corn, vegetable peas and beans. The Southern edge of this square is bounded by Limekiln Dyke which runs through woodland into Barton and Broad and is navigable to small craft for most of its length. The Northern side of the dyke is bounded by the Neatishead/Barton Road and is built up by residences for most of its length. Barton Church lies in this square although some two miles from Barton Turf village.
